page.title: 14PROTECTED BUILDINGS.
page.content: There are many such houses in Stockland.The Old Vicarage on the Axminster Road is very attractive with a pleasing courtyard.The out buildings along with the house make up three sides of a square.This is C18 having a slate roof & being made of stone rubble.The stables <out buildings> are more likely C19. On the Honiton Road,Park Bridge,which runs over a stream,is early C19 and bears a plaque which reads:DORSET Any person wilfully injuring any part of this County Bridge will be guilty of felony and upon conviction liable to be transported for life" Note Stockland used to be part of Dorset. Opposite the King's Arms,there are four C19 terraced cottages namely Peartree Cottage,Ivy Cottage,Rose Cottage and Farndale Cottage.
